title: OVERPROMPT workflow exits when bugs empty but features exist
description: The OVERPROMPT-standard.md workflow only processes bugs and skips features. When scan-prioritize-agent returns a queue with features but no bugs, the workflow exits to retrospective instead of processing the features. The bug-processor-agent is capable of processing both bugs and features (line 3: 'Processes bug/feature PROMPT.md files'), but the OVERPROMPT workflow only invokes it for bugs.
steps_to_reproduce: Create features with PROMPT.md files in feature-management/features/
Ensure no unresolved bugs exist in bugs/
Observe that workflow skips to Phase 6 (retrospective) instead of Phase 2 (processing)
expected_behavior: When the priority queue contains features and no bugs, the workflow should process the highest priority feature using bug-processor-agent.
actual_behavior: Workflow exits to retrospective when bug queue is empty, even though feature queue has unresolved items.

evidence.overprompt_line_373: IF no bugs: INVOKE retrospective-agent, then summary-reporter-agent

root_cause: OVERPROMPT-standard.md was designed with bug-only workflow in mind. Phase 2 title and logic references only 'bugs' instead of generic 'items'. Exit conditions check 'IF no bugs' instead of 'IF queue empty'.
impact: Features never get processed autonomously. Users must manually invoke bug-processor-agent for features, defeating the purpose of autonomous workflow.
